definition: woman's suit/dress worn over a petticoat

to cover/to encase/cover/sheath/to overlap/to interleave/to model after/to copy/formula/harness/loop of rope/(fig.) to fish for/to obtain slyly/classifier for sets, collections/bend (of a river or mountain range, in place names)/tau (Greek letter Ττ)

sentences.english: She wore her suit to the job interview.
sentences.chinese: 她穿上套裙去参加求职面试。
你的这款套裙现在还很流行。

sentences.english: Why should I wear a skirt? Or a dress?
sentences.chinese: 为什么我非得穿裙子或套裙呢？

sentences.english: My wife steps into a cotton dress while I shift into midnight-blue tropical pants and bowling shoes.
sentences.chinese: 妻子着棉布套裙，我改穿深蓝色热带休闲裤和球鞋。

sentences.english: The nail ripped a hole in her dress.
sentences.chinese: 她的套裙被钉子钩了一个洞。

sentences.english: I put on the grey suit. Immediately I began to sweat.
sentences.chinese: 当我刚穿上灰色的套裙，立刻开始出汗了。

sentences.english: This is because the bride will usually wear a white dress.
sentences.chinese: 这是因为新娘通常会穿着白色的套裙。

sentences.english: Does she wear mostly skirt suits?

definition: ceremonial robe/formal attire (dinner suit, evening gown etc)
old feminine garment, covering chest and abdomen
